## Natural history notes

The Florida false sunflower (Phoebanthus grandiflorus) is a native flower in the daisy (Asteraceae) family. Despite being much smaller, this flower gained its name due to its visual similarities to sunflowers (Helianthus spp.). Florida false sunflowers are endemic to Florida, meaning that it is only found in this state. Currently, this plant has only been found in 26 counties!
